summary: This is a fax from attorney Michael R. Tein to the U.S. Attorney's Office confirming that Jeffrey Epstein intends to abide by the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA). It discusses the agreement's terms, including the suspension of the federal grand jury investigation and deferral to Florida state prosecution, and addresses legal issues regarding a motion to quash and statutory obligations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the Non-Prosecution Agreement between federal prosecutors and the State of Florida, whose compliance is being confirmed.

persons.name: Michael R. Tein
persons.context: Author of the fax, representing Epstein's interests, confirming Epstein's intent to abide by the NPA and addressing procedural legal matters.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Copied on the fax, likely part of Epstein's legal team.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Copied on the fax, likely part of Epstein's legal team.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Copied on the fax; as U.S. Attorney, he was the lead federal prosecutor who approved the NPA.

persons.name: Judge Marra
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge who would resolve the legal question of whether a federal statute applies to pending civil litigation.

connections.description: Tein is communicating on behalf of Epstein, confirming his client's intent to comply with the Non-Prosecution Agreement.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, was the federal prosecutor who entered into the Non-Prosecution Agreement with Epstein.
Professional correspondence between defense attorney (Tein) and prosecutor (Acosta) regarding the implementation of the NPA.
Both are attorneys copied on the fax, indicating they are part of the same legal team representing Epstein.

events.title: U.S. Attorney's Letter to Epstein's Counsel
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a letter inquiring whether Epstein intended to fully abide by the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Tein's Fax Confirming NPA Compliance
events.description: Attorney Michael Tein sends a fax to the U.S. Attorney's Office confirming Epstein's intent to abide by the Non-Prosecution Agreement and addressing related legal procedures.

events.title: Execution of Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: A previously executed agreement between federal prosecutors and Epstein that suspended the federal grand jury investigation and deferred prosecution to the State of Florida, contingent on Epstein's compliance.

locations: 500 S. Australian Avenue West Palm Beach, Florida 33401
3059 Grand Avenue, Suite 340, Coconut Grove, Florida 33133
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's attorney, Michael R. Tein, formally confirmed Epstein's intent to fully abide by the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with federal prosecutors.
The NPA required the federal grand jury investigation to be suspended and all pending subpoenas held in abeyance unless Epstein violated the agreement.
Prosecution was deferred to the State of Florida under the NPA, provided Epstein complied with its conditions.
The document reveals direct communication between Epstein's defense team and U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta regarding the implementation of the controversial NPA.
A legal issue regarding the applicability of a federal statute (18 U.S.C. ยง 3509(k)) to stay civil cases is noted, with the resolution left to Judge Marra.
